text:
Yeah, you wish that they’d would take it seriously, but then you get responses like these:

1. We am not seeing a Cookie Banner appearing on their page, but I can see that banner.js is loading.
2. The banner script is part of our main script loader to check if a Cookie Banner is enabled in their Cookie Banner settings and this is expected to be present even if the Cookie Banner is switched off.
3. This behavior is default and is not changeable, but they should be aware that no banner is actually loading because it is <https://app-eu1.HubSpot.com/settings/25939969/data-privacy/cookies-v2|disabled in their HubSpot settings.>

“Let’s load 64 kb worth of script regardless of a cookie banner being activated or not”…

I’m lost for words actually
